title: Expert: China has failed to prepare residents when zero-Covid policy ends
description: As China slowly begins to roll back its zero-Covid policy, CNN's Ivan Watson speaks with experts about how China's elderly are at a higher risk of winter Covid surge and how the country has failed to prepare its residents for the roll back.

title: Brazil following situation in Peru with concern, foreign ministry says
CNN gets access to Ukrainian hospital performing life-saving surgeries on wounded troops
description: CNN's Sam Kiley visits a hospital in Kramatorsk, Ukraine, where doctors perform innovative life-saving surgeries on wounded troops.

title: Trump poses with QAnon, Pizzagate conspiracy theorist
description: Former President Donald Trump posed for photos at his waterfront club on Tuesday with a prominent QAnon conspiracy theorist, in the latest in a string of incidents that highlight the GOP candidate's proximity to fringe figures on the far right.

title: Twitter's makeshift hotel rooms show just how broken US work culture is
description: American work culture is having an identity crisis. Are we a #riseandgrind people or are we #QuietQuitting? Are we, as Elon Musk and Sam Bankman-Fried have modeled, going so "extremely hardcore" that we're willing to sleep at the office? Or are we evolving, recognizing the toxicity of hustle culture and finally setting boundaries?

title: Shaquille O'Neal pushed into Christmas tree during on-air race
description: During an on-air race on TNT's "Inside the NBA", Kenny Smith pushed co-host Shaquille O'Neal into a Christmas tree. It's not the first time this has happened either.

title: SE Cupp: Fox News won't face the truth in Georgia
description: In this week's episode of "Unfiltered," SE Cupp examines what's really driving Republican losses in critical states like Georgia -- and argues that the party and its pundits cannot seem to reckon with that truth.

title: Statins lower the risk of one of the deadliest kinds of strokes, study finds
description: Doctors know that drugs called statins lower a person's risk of a stroke due to a blood clot. But a new study shows that the inexpensive medications can also decrease the risk of a first stroke as a result of an intracerebral hemorrhage, the deadliest kind.

title: Reporter: 'Constitutional crisis' escalated after Peruvian president impeached
description: Peruvian lawmakers have voted to oust President Pedro Castillo, dramatically escalating the country's political crisis that began hours earlier when Castillo attempted to dissolve the legislative body and install an emergency government. Journalist Stefano Pozzebon has the latest.

title: She fled Afghanistan under the Taliban, now the US has put her future on hold
description: After fleeing the Taliban takeover of her home country of Afghanistan in 2021, Yalda Azamee thought her dreams came true when she was accepted to two of America's top universities.

title: Anne Heche not impaired by drugs at time of crash, coroner's report shows
description: There were no active drugs found in actress Anne Heche's system at the time of her car crash in August, according to a Los Angeles County Medical Examiner-Coroner report released Tuesday.

title: Takeaways from historic US Supreme Court hearing that could upend election rules
description: Arguments in the Supreme Court's blockbuster election rules case played out for more than three hours on Wednesday as the justices examined claims from the North Carolina GOP legislature, which argues that state constitutions and state courts have little or no authority to impose limits on how state legislatures craft their rules for federal elections.

title: Hawaii's 2 volcanic eruptions keep spewing lava with no end in sight. Here's what could happen next
description: The incessant lava shooting out of Hawaii's Mauna Loa and Kilauea volcanoes has stirred memories of Kilauea's devastating 2018 eruption, which swallowed hundreds of homes.

title: Elon Musk is on the verge of losing his world's richest person title
description: Elon Musk is on the verge of losing his status as the world's richest person, at least according to one metric.

title: Peru's President says he will dissolve Congress, hours before third impeachment vote
description: Peru's President Pedro Castillo announced on Wednesday that he will dissolve Congress temporarily, and will install an emergency government -- hours before lawmakers were due to make an impeachment vote in congress.

title: 'I was wheeling and dealing with God': Cruise passenger describes over 15 hours lost at sea
description: CNN's Kate Bolduan speaks with James Michael Grimes, who fell overboard from a Carnival cruise ship in the Gulf of Mexico. Grimes was found by the US Coast Guard after staying afloat for what he believes was more than 15 hours.

title: CNN reporter: Search part of effort to 'satisfy' subpoena
description: Lawyers for former President Donald Trump recently hired a team to search four of his properties for any potentially remaining classified materials, according to a source familiar the matter. CNN's Evan Perez has more.

title: Oldest DNA sheds light on a 2 million-year-old ecosystem that has no modern parallel
description: A core of ice age sediment from northern Greenland has yielded the world's oldest sequences of DNA.

title: Amateur fossil hunters find rare intact plesiosaur skeleton
description: Amateur paleontologists in Queensland, Australia uncovered a rare, 100 million-year-old marine reptile's skeleton that could provide vital clues about prehistoric life.

title: NATO chief: Russia looking to 'freeze' war to 'regroup for bigger offensive'
description:
• Zelensky named TIME person of the year
• Soldiers reveal what happened to them inside Russian prison

title: US Supreme Court hears case that could upend electoral politics
As Harry and Meghan's Netflix documentary looms, Buckingham Palace braces for royal revelations
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex's new six-part docu-series is set to drop on Netflix on Thursday.

title: Series of mistakes led to prison beating death of Boston gangster Whitey Bulger, report shows
description: The Justice Department's Office of the Inspector General released a report on Wednesday outlining how a series of mistakes by the embattled Bureau of Prisons led to the beating death of imprisoned Boston gangster and convicted murderer James "Whitey" Bulger four years ago.

title: Adorable pooch can't be trusted with fire alarm
description: Birdie the golden retriever pulls fire alarm at doggie day care. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports she had to wear a naughty dog apology sign.

title: Iran's former president urges government to be more lenient with protesters
description: Iran's former president Mohammad Khatami has urged the current government to be more lenient with protesters, amid ongoing nationwide demonstrations representing the biggest challenge to the Islamic Republic in decades.

title: 13 stranded strangers went on a road trip. Here's what happened
description: What do you do when your evening flight is canceled, you really need to be somewhere in the morning and there are no other available flights?

title: Mother of fallen Capitol Police officer shares why she snubbed GOP leaders
description: CNN's Poppy Harlow and Don Lemon speak with the family of fallen US Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick, after they snubbed Republican leaders Sen. Mitch McConnell and Rep. Kevin McCarthy at a ceremony held to honor law enforcement who defended the US Capitol during the January 6, 2021, insurrection.

title: Trump lawyers hire outside team to search four properties for classified info
description: Lawyers for former President Donald Trump recently hired a team to search four of his properties for any potentially remaining classified materials, according to a source familiar the matter.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping lands in Saudi Arabia amid tensions with US
TikTok's 'How much is your rent?' is the new MTV Cribs
description: "Nightcap's" Jon Sarlin talks to Caleb Simpson, the content creator whose NYC apartment tours have gone viral on TikTok and YouTube.

title: Crews race to repair Ukraine's energy system as hospitals suspend surgeries after strikes
Wordle is the most-searched term on Google in 2022
description: Admit it: You've probably either Googled the answer for Wordle, or at the very least searched to play it. Turns out, you're not alone.

title: Italy implements one-way foot traffic in 'dangerously' overtouristed street
description: As tourism returns with a vengeance, some destinations are swiftly becoming overwhelmed.

title: Casey Anthony shares her version of events in a new docuseries. What you need to know
description: Casey Anthony is back in the national spotlight more than a decade after she was acquitted in the killing of her 2-year-old daughter.

title: 2022 People's Choice Awards: The winners list
description: The fans have spoken about what they found to be the best in movies, television, music and pop culture.

title: New York Yankees and Aaron Judge reportedly agree on nine-year deal worth $360 million
description: New York Yankees and slugger Aaron Judge have reportedly agreed on a nine-year deal worth $360 million, sources told ESPN, The Athletic senior writer Ken Rosenthal and MLB Network insider Jon Morosi on Wednesday.

title: UK strikes to hit ambulance services, hospitals and trains in the run up to Christmas
description: Britain is bracing for further disruption from strikes heading into the Christmas period, as ambulance drivers and nurses join rail operators and postal workers in the worst wave of walkouts the country has endured for at least a decade.

title: Ryan Reynolds honors Blake Lively and family in People's Choice Awards speech
description: Ryan Reynolds was being celebrated Tuesday night at the 2022 People's Choice Awards, but he made the moment about his family.

title: Meta avoids showdown over news content in US after journalism bargaining bill shelved
description: A threat by Facebook owner Meta to remove news content from its platforms appears to have been averted — for now — after US lawmakers omitted an antitrust bill it opposed from the text of an annual defense spending bill released late Tuesday evening.

title: 'It's cheating. It's lying. It's greed': Manhattan DA weighs in on Trump Org. conduct
description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg discusses the guilty verdict for two Trump Organization companies on multiple charges of criminal tax fraud and falsifying business records connected to a 15-year scheme to defraud tax authorities by failing to report and pay taxes on compensation for top executives.

title: Could Cristiano Ronaldo be Portugal's super sub for the rest of the World Cup?
Why Zelensky was named TIME magazine's person of the year
description: TIME magazine has named Volodymyr Zelensky, the Ukrainian leader whose attempt to fight off Russia's invasion of his country has won widespread acclaim, as its person of the year, alongside "the spirit of Ukraine."

title: Morocco's World Cup success isn't a fluke
description: After three hours of constant noise, the Education City Stadium was brought to library-like silence as Achraf Hakimi stood over the penalty spot.

title: CNN captures Ukrainian POW's emotional return home
description: CNN travels to an undisclosed location near the Russian border to witness the arrival of two buses carrying sixty Ukrainian prisoners that released in a swap with Russia. CNN's Will Ripley has the exclusive report.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping lands in Riyadh as US watches closely
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping landed in the Saudi Arabian capital Riyadh on Wednesday for a multiple-day visit, China's official news agency Xinhua reported, amid frayed ties between the two countries and the United States.

title: Priyanka Chopra Jonas says she is finally earning as much as her male co-star
description: Priyanka Chopra Jonas says she is finally earning as much as her male co-star, after two decades in the movie industry.

title: Could Cristiano Ronaldo be Portugal's super sub for the rest of the World Cup?
description: Cristiano Ronaldo has found himself in unfamiliar territory this season -- but no matter where he is in the stadium, the cameras follow.

title: Companies can't imagine life without the CEO. That's a problem
description: Nothing lasts forever, not even a good CEO.

title: See how Raphael Warnock beat Herschel Walker county-by-county
description: After a long and expensive campaign season in Georgia, Sen. Raphael Warnock won reelection as one of Georgia's two Democratic US Senators. CNN's John Berman explains how.

title: A growing push to fix pulse oximeters' flawed readings in people of color: 'This can be dangerous'
description: As a triple threat of respiratory illnesses -- flu, Covid-19 and respiratory syncytial virus, known as RSV -- sweeps the United States, emergency departments are using one small tool more than usual to monitor whether a patient needs oxygen: the pulse oximeter.

title: Baker Mayfield joins struggling Los Angeles Rams as former No. 1 draft pick battles to revive career
description: The Los Angeles Rams claimed former No. 1 overall pick Baker Mayfield off waivers on Tuesday as the team looks to strengthen its quarterback room in the wake of recent injuries.

title: Jamaica declares widespread state of emergency to fight violent crime
description: A widespread state of emergency has been declared across Jamaica to fight violent crime, the island nation's Prime Minister Andrew Holness said in a public address Wednesday.

title: Harry and Meghan accept award in New York ahead of release of Netflix series
description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have said "we know a ripple of hope can turn into a wave of change" after they were honored in New York for their work on racial justice and mental health.

title: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recovery.

title: UK tries to shore up energy supply with US deal
description: Britain has agreed a new energy partnership with the United States that aims to end its reliance on Russia and lower soaring energy costs.

title: Germany arrests 25 suspected far-right extremists for plotting to overthrow government
description: German officials arrested 22 suspected members and three suspected supporters of a far-right terrorist organization across the country on Wednesday on suspicion of plotting to overthrow the government.

title: How you sleep can cause neck and back pain
description: Neck pain may have many causes: Stress, poor posture, texting, injuries from sports, car or other accidents and chronic illnesses such as fibromyalgia, to name a few. But there's another culprit you may not be considering — how you sleep.

title: Football saved his life -- now this former Ghana star is scouting the next generation of underprivileged talent
description: "Somebody said that football's a matter of life and death to you; I said 'listen, it's more important than that.'"

title: Palestinian flag waved on pitch as Morocco celebrates historic World Cup win
description: Several players of Morocco's national team unfurled a Palestinian flag on the pitch while celebrating their historic World Cup win over Spain in Qatar on Tuesday.

title: Full 'cold moon' shines bright and eclipses Mars in a rare event
description: December's full moon, also known as the "cold moon," will shine bright in the night sky this Wednesday, peaking at 11:08 p.m. ET.

title: A family death during the holidays prompts questions and reflection
description: It wasn't the Thanksgiving holiday any of us had expected.

title: Saudi's MBS rolls out the red carpet for China's Xi, in a not too subtle message to Biden
description: When Chinese President Xi Jinping lands in Riyadh in the coming hours Saudi leaders are expected to receive him with the pomp and circumstance normally reserved for the kingdom's most strategic ally, the United States.

title: 'I would whiten my skin no matter the cost'. CNN readers around the globe tell of the pressure to look whiter.
Man in China fined $478 for reclining his train seat
description: The ongoing debate about whether it's acceptable to recline your seat while traveling has taken a turn in China's Hunan province after a man was fined for leaning back on a train.

title: New Zealand court takes guardianship of baby after parents refuse vaccinated blood for heart surgery
description: A critically-ill six-month-old baby will be placed under the temporary guardianship of New Zealand's High Court after his parents refused to allow him to undergo lifesaving heart surgery using blood from people vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Russian drones and missiles strike Zaporizhzhia
description:
• Blasts deep inside Russia give Putin a problem
• Strikes on Russian bases: What we know

title: The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
Camille Herron put her 'heart and soul' into breaking the 100-mile world record. But officials now say the course was too short
description: Camille Herron has called it a "unicorn moment" for the sport of ultrarunning -- a performance that expanded the notion of what women can achieve in endurance events.

title: Argentina's Cristina Fernández de Kirchner sentenced to six years in prison for corruption
description: A court in Argentina on Tuesday sentenced the country's vice president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, to six years in prison and disqualified her from holding public office again after finding her guilty of corruption during her earlier terms as President.

title: Canadian police believe the remains of 2 indigenous women who were victims of a serial killer are likely in a landfill, but will not search the site
description: Authorities in Canada believe the remains of two indigenous women who died at the hands of an alleged serial killer are likely in a landfill, but police have decided not to conduct a search at the site, citing hazards and ground conditions.

title: 100 million-year-old plesiosaur skeleton discovery 'could hold the key' to prehistoric research
description: The discovery of a giant 100 million-year-old marine reptile's skeleton in Australia has been hailed by researchers as a breakthrough that may provide vital clues about prehistoric life.

title: China announced sweeping changes to its national pandemic response on Wednesday, after the country faced its most widespread protests in decades
51st seat gives Democrats true majority in Georgia Senate runoff
description: • Analysis: This kind of week could break Donald Trump

title: Trump Organization found guilty on all counts of criminal tax fraud
On GPS: Is China's zero-Covid strategy finally over?
description: Newsweek Bureau Chief Melinda Liu joins Fareed to discuss widespread protests against China's strict coronavirus measures.

title: The 'Blue Marble': One of Earth's most iconic images, 50 years on
description: On Christmas Eve in 1972, humanity received a gift: A portrait of the Earth as a vivid globe.

title: Magic Wall: How Warnock beat Walker in Georgia
description: CNN's David Chalian looks at how Democratic incumbent Sen. Raphael Warnock was able to defeat Republican Herschel Walker in the Georgia US Senate race.

title: Warnock's win is a final midterm rebuke of Trump's influence
The New York Times is bracing for a historic mass walkout as union negotiations go down to the wire
description: The New York Times is preparing for more than 1,100 of its union staffers to go on strike for a full day Thursday — an act of protest that has not been staged by employees at the paper of record since the late 1970s.

title: Ex-Trump White House official says Trump is liable for Walker's loss
description: CNN political commentator and former Trump official Alyssa Farah Griffin says the former president negatively impacted Georgia's Senate runoff race for the Republican Party.

title: 'It feels good!': Van Jones reacts to Warnock's win
description: CNN Political Commentator Van Jones reacts to Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock's win in the Georgia's runoff.

title: See the moment CNN called the race for Warnock
description: CNN projects that Sen. Raphael Warnock will win reelection in the Georgia Senate runoff. CNN's Eva McKend reports from Warnock headquarters as the results come in.

title: Amber Heard appeals defamation case loss to ex-husband Johnny Depp
description: Lawyers for Amber Heard officially appealed her loss in a defamation case brought by Johnny Depp, arguing there were several errors in the trial, according to reporting from the Los Angeles Times.

title: With eye on China, US to boost military forces in Australia -- and 'invite' Japan to join in
description: The United States will increase the rotational presence of air, land and sea forces in Australia, including bomber aircraft and fighter jets, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said Tuesday, amid shared concerns about China.

title: Bodycam shows SWAT team searching a 77-year-old's home on false 'Find my iPhone' ping
description: A Denver Police Department SWAT team searched a 77-year-old woman's home after a "Find My" iPhone app ping in the area. The ACLU of Colorado has filed a lawsuit on her behalf.

title: TSA discovers dog in a carry-on bag at Wisconsin airport checkpoint
description: It's been a week of weird finds for the Transportation Security Administration: A six-pack of nunchucks and other sharp objects -- and now a dog in a backpack.

title: World's first 'upcycled' skyscraper saves Australian tower from demolition
description: Once Sydney's tallest building, the AMP Centre was showing its age. The outdated 1970s structure had come to the end of its lifespan, and the tower's owners wanted to replace it with something bigger, better and more energy-efficient.

title: Why people whiten their skin: Understanding the pressure to be whiter
